channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A $400,000 profit on Maduro's capture raises insider trading questions on Polymarket
item.description: Online sleuths have tried to uncover who placed a winning bet on the Venezuelan leader's arrest to no avail. Still, prediction market watchers say the bet appears suspicious.
item.content:encoded:
Online sleuths have tried to uncover who placed a winning bet on the Venezuelan leader's arrest to no avail. Still, prediction market watchers say the bet appears suspicious.

(Image credit: Juan Barreto)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Kremlin condemns U.S. military operation in Venezuela
item.description: The U.S. essentially carried out the 'special military operation' that Russia planned for — and failed to accomplish — in Kyiv four years ago. Will this further embolden Russia?
item.content:encoded: The U.S. essentially carried out the 'special military operation' that Russia planned for — and failed to accomplish — in Kyiv four years ago. Will this further embolden Russia?
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Trump opposed regime change — but now he says the U.S. is 'in charge' of Venezuela
item.description: President Trump has long railed against regime change and nation building. Now he says "we're in charge" of Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has long railed against regime change and nation building. Now he says "we're in charge" of Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Venezuela swears in interim leader, seeking to show it operates free from U.S. control
item.description: Delcy Rodríguez was sworn in as interim president, as the Venezuelan government sought to show its people and the world that it is being run independently.
item.content:encoded:
Delcy Rodríguez was sworn in as interim president, as the Venezuelan government sought to show its people and the world that it is being run independently.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Maduro and wife plead not guilty to narco-terrorism charges
item.description: Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores have pleaded not guilty to all charges during their first court appearance in their federal narco-terrorism case.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores have pleaded not guilty to all charges during their first court appearance in their federal narco-terrorism case.

(Image credit: José A. Alvarado Jr. for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Holocaust survivor Eva Schloss, the stepsister of Anne Frank, dies at 96
item.description: Schloss, who was friends with Frank in Amsterdam and whose mother later married Frank's father, was a tireless educator about the Holocaust and was honorary president of The Anne Frank Trust UK.
item.content:encoded:
Schloss, who was friends with Frank in Amsterdam and whose mother later married Frank's father, was a tireless educator about the Holocaust and was honorary president of The Anne Frank Trust UK.

(Image credit: Jae C. Hong)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Who is in charge of Venezuela? And, what to expect from Maduro's court appearance
item.description: The U.S. forces' capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife in Caracas has left many people with questions. Here's what we know so far, including who is running the country.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. forces' capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife in Caracas has left many people with questions. Here's what we know so far, including who is running the country.

(Image credit: Juan Barreto)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump claims U.S. will 'run' Venezuela, but there are no troops in the country
item.description: What's next for the U.S. engagement in Venezuela? President Trump says the U.S. will run the country for now, but there are no American troops or diplomats in the country.
item.content:encoded: What's next for the U.S. engagement in Venezuela? President Trump says the U.S. will run the country for now, but there are no American troops or diplomats in the country.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Venezuelans react to U.S. capture of Maduro and the future of their country
item.description: Three Venezuelans react to the U.S. operation that removed Nicolas Maduro from power and what U.S. involvement might mean in the long run.
item.content:encoded: Three Venezuelans react to the U.S. operation that removed Nicolas Maduro from power and what U.S. involvement might mean in the long run.
item.dc:creator: David Martin Davies

item.title: After Venezuela attack, Cuba watches the U.S. warily
item.description: With his attack on Venezuela, President Trump says the Monroe Doctrine is back, reviving a more than 200-year-old foreign policy idea. In Cuba, residents brace for what that could mean for them.
item.content:encoded:
With his attack on Venezuela, President Trump says the Monroe Doctrine is back, reviving a more than 200-year-old foreign policy idea. In Cuba, residents brace for what that could mean for them.

(Image credit: Ramon Espinosa)
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta
